Name: acetamide-anillide-compound production, unspecified | acetamide-anillide-compound, unspecified | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/202:Manufacture of other chemical products/2021:Manufacture of pesticides and other agrochemical products
Description: Acetamide-anilide-compounds are herbicides with an anilide functional group. Amides are usually produced by reacting an amine with an acid (acetanilide) or an acid chloride (chloroacetanilide).;;The dataset acetamide-anilide-compounds was calculated from the arithmetic mean of all inputs and outputs of the production of diflufenican, dimethenamid, metazachlor, metolachlor, napropamide, phenmedipham, and S-metolachlor.;;Diflufenican is produced in eight steps from acetaldehyde:; 3 C2H4O → C6H12O3;4 C6H12O3 + 3 NH3 → 3 C8H11N + 12 H2O;C8H11N + 8 HNO3 → C7H5NO4 + 7 H2O + 5 NO + CO2 + 3 NO2;C7H5NO4 → C6H5NO2 + CO2;C6H5NO2 + Cl2 → C6H4NO2Cl + HCl;C6H4NO2Cl + C7H5F3O → C13H8F3NO3 + HCl;C13H8F3NO3 + SOCl2 → C13H7F3NClO2 + HCl + SO2;C13H7F3NClO2 + C6H5NF2 → C19H11F5N2O2 + HCl;Precursors that are used for the diflufenican production are trifluoromethyl phenol (C6H5NF2), thionyl chloride (SOCl2), and 2,4-difluoro aniline (C6H2F2NO2).;;Dimethenamide is produced in nine steps from ethylene: ;C2H4 + CO + H2O → C3H6O2;C3H6O2 + Cl2 → C3H5ClO + HCl;C3H5ClO + NaSH + H2O → C3H5O2SNa + HCl + H2;C3H5O2SNa + HCl → C3H6O2S + NaCl;C3H6O2S + C4H6O2 → C7H12O4S;C7H12O4S → C6H10OS + CO2 + H2O;C6H10OS + C4H11NO → C10H19NOS + H2O;2 C10H19NOS + 2 SOCl2 → 2 C10H17NOS + SO2 + S + 4 HCl;C10H17NOS + C2H2Cl2O → C12H18ClNO2S + HCl;Precursors that are used for the dimethenamide production are chloroacetyl chloride (C2H2Cl2O), methacrylic acid (C4H6O2), 1-methoxy-2-amino-propane (C4H11NO), sodium hydrosulfide (NaSH), and thionyl chloride (SOCl2).;;Metazachlor is produced in five steps from xylene: ;C8H10 + HNO3 → C8H9NO2 + H2O;C6H5N3O4 + H2 → C8H11N + H2O;C8H11N + C2H3Cl2O → C10H14NClO + HCl;3 C10H12NClO + C3H6O3 + 3 HCl → 3 C11H14NCl2O + 3 H2O;C11H14NCl2O + C3H4N2 → C14H16ClN3O + HCl;Precursors that are used for the metazachlor production are chloroacetyl chloride (C2H2Cl2O), paraformaldehyde (C3H6O3), pyrazole (C3H4N2), and thionyl chloride (SOCl2).;;Metolachlor is produced in five steps from toluene: ;C8H10 + HNO3 → C8H9NO2 + H2O;C7H7NO2 + 3 H2 → C7H9N + 2 H2O;C7H9N + C2H4 → C9H14N;C9H14N + C4H8O2 + H2 → C13H21ON + H2O;C13H21ON + C2H2Cl2O → C15H22ClNO2 + HCl;Precursors that are used for the metolachlor production are chloroacetyl chloride (C2H2Cl2O), methoxyacetone (C4H7O2), and thionyl chloride (SOCl2).;;Napropamide is produced in five steps from ethylene: ;C2H4 + CO + H2O → C3H6O2;C3H6O2 + Br2 → C3H5BrO2 + HBr;C3H5BrO2 + SOCl2 → C3H4BrClO + SO2 + HCl;C3H4BrClO + C4H11N → C7H14NBrO + HCl;C7H14NBrO + C10H8O → C17H21NO2 + HBr;Precursors that are used for the napropamide production are -naphthol (C10H8O3S) and thionyl chloride (SOCl2).;;Phenmedipham is produced in six steps from nitrobenzene: ;C6H5NO2 + H2SO4 → C6H5NO5S + H2O;C6H5NO5S + 3 H2 → C6H7O3S + 2 H2O;7C6H7NO3S + 3 NaOH → C6H6NONa + Na2SO3 + 2 H2O;C6H6NONa + H2SO4 → C6H7NO + NaHSO4;C6H7NO + C2H3ClO2 → C8H9NO2 + HCl;C8H9NO2 + C8H7NO → C16H16N2O3;Precursors that are used for the phenmedipham production are m-isocyanato toluene (C8H7NO) and methyl chloroformate (C2H3ClO2).;;Precursors:;;Chloroacetyl chloride (C2H2Cl2O) is produced in two steps from acetic acid: ;C2H4O2 + Cl2 → C2H3ClO2 + HCl;C2H3ClO2 + SOCl2 → C2H2Cl2O + HCl + SO2;;2,4-Difluoro aniline (C6H2F2NO2) is produced in four steps from p-dichlorobenzene:;C6H4Cl2 + Cl2 → C6H3Cl3 + HCl;C6H3Cl3 + HNO3 → C6H2Cl3NO2 + H2O;C6H2Cl3NO2 + 2 HF → C6H2ClF2NO2 + 2 HCl;C6H2ClF2NO2 + H2 → C6H2F2NO2 + HCl; ;Methacrylic acid (C4H6O2) is produced in three steps from acetone: ;C3H6O + HCN → C4H7NO;C4H7NO + H2SO4 → C4H9NO5S;C4H9NO5S + H2O → C4H6O2 + NH4HSO4;;Methyl chloroformate (C2H3ClO2) is produced from methanol and phosgene: ;CH4O + CCl2O → C2H3ClO2 + HCl;;Methoxyacetone (C4H7O2) is produced in three steps from cumene : ;C9H12 + O2 → C9H12O2;C9H12O2 + C3H6O → C3H6O2 + C9H12O;C3H6O2 + CH4O → C4H7O2 + H2O;;1-Methoxy-2-amino-propane (C4H11NO) is produced in two steps from propylene oxide: ;C3H6O + NH3 → C3H9NO;C3H9NO + CH4O → C4H11NO + H2O;;m-Isocyanato toluene (C8H7NO) is produced in three steps from toluene: ;C7H8 + HNO3 → C7H7NO2 + 2 H2O;C7H7NO2 + 3 H2 → C7H9N + 2 H2O;C7H9N + CCl2O → C8H7NO + 2 HCl;;-Naphthol (C10H8O3S) is produced in two steps from naphthalene: ;C10H8 + H2SO4 → C10H8O3S + H2O;C10H8O3S + 2 NaOH → C10H8O + Na2SO4 + H2O;;Paraformaldehyde (C3H6O3) is produced from formaldehyde: ;3 CH2O → C3H6O3;;Pyrazole (C3H4N2) is produced in four steps from sodium hypochlorite: ;NaOCl + NH3 → NH2Cl + NaOH;NH2Cl + NaOH + NH3 → N2H4 + NaCl + H2O;N2H4 + CHCl3 → CH2N2 + 3 HCl;CH2N2 + C2H4 → C3H4N2 + H2;;Sodium hydrogen sulfide (NaSH) is produced from hydrogen sulfide and sodium hydroxide: ;H2S + NaOH → NaSH + H2O;;3-Trifluoromethyl phenol (C6H5NF2) is produced in five steps from toluene: ;C7H8 + Cl2 → C7H7Cl;C7H7Cl + NaOH → C7H7ONa;C7H7ONa + HCl → C7H8O + NaCl;C7H8O + 3 Cl2 → C7H5Cl3O + 3 HCl;C7H5Cl3O + 3 HF → C7H5F3O + 3 HCl;;Thionyl chloride (SOCl2) is produced in two steps from sulphur: ;S + Cl2 → SCl2;SCl2 + SO2 + Cl2 → 2 SOCl2
